A digital service has a lifespan that it is important to extend as much as possible.
Often there is a beta version, then other features will be added by and by.
It is important to raise these questions from the design of the service with the various partners and customers in order to develop a flexible and adaptable service over time.
This will limit the financial and environmental costs in the long term because the service will be scalable, thus extending its lifespan.

uxui.title: Are all the components of the interface the subject of special attention in terms of Sustainable IT impact, while respecting accessibility rules ?
uxui.test:
Is a suitable visual theme (dark / light) proposed to the user, in a simple, quick and modifiable way (automatically or manually), according to the different terminals?
A "Low" theme, refined in terms of interface elements (visuals, animations, videos, touch, etc.) is it explained and offered to the user from his first use and can he easily modify this option? any time ?
uxui.description:
The simpler the visual theme, the more efficient it will be in resources consumed to display it.
The more components the service implements (load on servers, networks and devices), the greater the impact of the number of concurrent users.
The technical solution is often to oversize the production environments to ensure better fluidity on service.
leaving the choice to users of service's presentation that uses less energy will help reduce the environmental footprint (network congestion and over-sizing of infrastructures).
With the increase of users number,  the service will become lighter, the overall scope will remain constant and / or controlled with precisely dimensioned technical means.
In addition, this will have an educational role: the user will be able to become an actor in his own consumption and his environmental footprint.

uxui.title: Are solutions without a "graphical" interface forseen for certain functionalities, in order to offer alternatives to visual design in the interface ?
uxui.test:
Is a voice or gestural version of the interface feasible, for the user and the ICT Sustainable?
If so, is it offered to the user beginning from  his first use of the service?
uxui.description: An interface is not just about the visual elements contained, it can be interesting to challenge other approaches to the user experience in order to reduce the impact of the service.

uxui.title: Is a Sustainable IT-oriented configuration space made available to the user, to limit the number of presentation elements as much as possible ?
uxui.test: Is there a quickly accessible space, where the user can manage the so-called “eco” parameters of the UI?
uxui.description:
Every action counts and the user has a key role  in reducing their environmental footprint.
Raise user's awareness and allow him to be an actor.
Informing about the impact of its actions and proposing simple and rapid alternatives will make it possible to have a more responsible use of the service and to develop a collective conscience, in the long term, concerning digital pollution.

uxui.title: Is the dematerialization of the service complete, and if the production of paper documents is essential, is it designed to limit its impact to the lowest possible ?
uxui.test: Are the screens affected by printing identified and their usefulness demonstrated?
uxui.description: The flows of dematerialization are sometimes broken, and require written documents output. The user, in some cases, may also be more comfortable using printed documents rather than 100% electronic. Printings have a significant environmental footprint, whether in paper consumption, consumables such as cartridges and printing inks. The printed presentation, or electronic presentation are different, on the other hand the limitation of the environmental footprint must lead to a diminution in the  volume of printed information

uxui.title: Is the user able to manage activation and use of third party solutions ?
uxui.test: Is the user able to decide using third party solutions?
uxui.description: Third party solutions may provide value to service, but on the other hand it connects the user to practices he may not wish. The user must be allowed to control usage of third party solutions.

uxui.title: Is a systemic approach method implemented, handled by the actors and associated with tools ?
uxui.test: Have the Sytem Design tools been used?
uxui.description: Starting a project without taking into account the ecosystem of the project / context can have a significant impact on the ROI. Implementing a systemic and iterative approach makes it possible to be more efficient and responsible to fulfil ther requirements and thus reduce ROI times.

uxui.title: Has the solution been prototyped upstream, with the user journey and interactions ?
uxui.test: Are the prototypes validated by all stakeholders and is there a monitoring and approbation system?
uxui.description: Interactive prototyping makes it possible, at a least cost, to have a graphic, ergonomic and technical preview of the future solution, to navigate but also to test it. By iteration, the prototype will be of better quality.

uxui.title: Have user's behavior and feedback been examined to best meet their needs ?
uxui.test: Are the static and animated prototypes tested on the studied by a group of users?
uxui.description: The project is implemented for users, taking their approach into account, their feedback on the solution's  use solution must be a priority. Having your solution tested by a groupe  of users allows you to have real feedback from the field and to adapt the project to better meet needs.

uxui.title: Is the design documented (functionally and technically), the design deliverables must be comprehensible by the project team and transferable to the development team ?
uxui.test: Have the specification exchange processes and formats been discussed and approved between designers, developers and stakeholders extensively?
uxui.description: Too many inadequate documents are produced during the design phases. Synchronization between the different levels of expectations (both in substance and in form) will improve project management and avoid frustrations on all sides as well as the energy and human impact.

uxui.title: Have the most frequent searches been investigated and submited so that they are either cached or displayed to the user without sending unnecessary requests or clicks. ?
uxui.test: Is a list of the most requested services and "fail requests" provided? are the "power requests" specified?
uxui.description: Internat search engines usage in the service allow users to access information faster by limiting browsing on the service. These search engines are therefore an asset from the point of view of environmental efficiency and user assistance. On the other hand, they may not have all the answers and rely on remote resources that are expensive to consult. It is important to reduce the exchanges between your service and the remote servers so as not to cancel out the benefits acquired by the use of the search engine.
uxui.score: Sollicitation des caches / Requètes de recherche

uxui.title: Is the path taken to access the service as quick and as simple as possible ?
uxui.test: Are the number of stages and the time included in the user journey / maps?
uxui.description: There are several scenarios for accessing the services and / or information of an application. They need to be looked at and made to coexist in order to improve the user experience.

uxui.title: Has a continuous improvement process been deployed ?
uxui.test: Is the design iteratively thought out?
uxui.description: Over time, the organization will increase its Sustainable IT maturity. Services must be able to benefit from this progress to enrich themselves with more sustainable embedded IT intelligence

uxui.title: Is a media management / use policy in place to reduce their impact, with criteria for media compression and formats ?
uxui.test: Is an environmental quality checklist of the media used in the service used?
uxui.description: The volume of data transferred increases the environmental footprint of the service. It is necessary to provide the necessary media to display the service in the appropriate compression in order to improve the service and increase its sobriety.
uxui.score: Number of compressed media / Number of media used

uxui.title: Are the number of fonts and the variants of fonts called (weight, characters used in the project) limited ?
uxui.test: Can a system typo be used?
uxui.description: Fonts can be very large. By reducing the number of policies only to those used in the service, the volume exchanged decreases.

uxui.title: Can the functionality be offered without calling external scripts or libraries (JS, AJAX, ...) ?
uxui.test: How many functions are managed via external libraries?
uxui.description: The user peripherals have processing resources, the use of these resources consumes energy and requires the executable codes to be send to the user peripheral. By reducing the use of scripts that run on the user station both aspects are reduced. Futerhmore, some users may not be able to use scripts.

uxui.title: Does the target functionality require calling an iFrame ?
uxui.test: Is an API solution available?
uxui.description: The accessibility of an iframe is null and the  pages' ergonomics  offering the service being restricted, the iFrame is a solution that will downgrade the user experience.

uxui.title: Can the native system features and components match as needed ?
uxui.test: Is the fact that the system does not natively offer the service established?
uxui.description: Some features are available in multiple forms. When native, no additional code or components are required to use them, reducing the impact of the service.
uxui.score: Number of features analyzed / Number of concerned features

uxui.title: Are videos and animations only used when they add value to the user ?
uxui.test: Can't the information shared by the video or animation be transcribed into an alternate format?
uxui.description: Video streams and animations generate a large amount of data. Limiting videos reduces the environmental burden on the service. Some audiences are not able to use videos, so they will be excluded from the service if it relies on this type of media.
uxui.score: Number of analyzed videos / Number of videos

uxui.score: Number of compressed media / Number of media used

uxui.title: Is the shared information useful to the user ?
uxui.test: Is useful information accessible throughout user journeys?
uxui.description: The efficient use of a digital service is based on the user's understanding of how to meet their expectations. The information that the digital service communicates must allow this efficiency, nevertheless unnecessary information can confuse its comprehension and generate behaviors which are not optimal and thus generating useless actions for the user and impacting for the environment.

uxui.title: Have the notification of all machine / user interactions been taken into account to systematically give the user the result of his actions and manage errors ?
uxui.test: Are all error cases tested internally and by end users?
uxui.description: Actions triggered by the user can lead to errors. In order to prevent the user from repeating the same errors, he must be informed that an error has occurred and indicate the cause or the procedure to correct it. On the contrary, when an action takes place without anomalies, the user must also know it so as not to repeat the same action.
uxui.score: Number of interaction analyzed / Number of user interactions

uxui.title: Are user feedback  of the service taken into account ?
uxui.test: Is a conversation channel for feedback on the quality of the services and content offered available and used in the context of improving the services and content?
uxui.description: The measurement of user satisfaction or dissatisfaction is an important marker of experience feedback which makes it possible to improve the service's quality  and deal with erroneous cases which would not be directly visible but would have consequences on the overall performance of the service to fulfill the expected features.

uxui.title: Does the user have the means to check the information presented in the service ?
uxui.test: Is a transparency verification process is established?
uxui.description: When the information imparted is not considered reliable by the users, it can generate additional research to confirm assertions and generate spurious navigation. On the other hand, the credibility of the service can be questioned and discarded by users. Users have the right to have reliable information, service editors have a duty to respect their users by transmitting verified information.

uxui.title: Are each of the actions initiated by the user ?
uxui.test: Has a service interaction map been produced to guarantee user action for each action?
uxui.description: The operating mode of the digital service must be transparent to the user, the actions proposed must be clearly described and the consequences exposed.
uxui.score: Number of interaction analyzed / Number of user interactions

uxui.title: Are users informed that confidential information is being collected ?
uxui.test:
Are users informed of the use that will be made of their confidential information?
Is the information on the use of the data collected made accessible and easily searchable, has the DPO been consulted?
Are the check boxes on the forms not pre-filled?
uxui.description: The users entrusted data are under your responsibility and users must be kept informed of the attention you give to ensure their data's  confidentiality. The GDPR imposes a framework for personal data but does not cover other categories of data which would nevertheless deserve the same attention and precautions.

uxui.title: Are rules in terms of respect for the user in place ?
uxui.test: Is a digital ethics charter defined?
uxui.description: Addictions, some services are designed to create some form of dependence on it. The user must be able to objectively remain the judge of his digital consumption

uxui.title: Does the service avoid Dark Patterns ?
uxui.test: Can Force Continuity (subscription perpetuation) be banned from the services offered?
uxui.description: Some services are designed to create some form of dependence on it. The user must not be forced and exposed to certain mechanisms of digital over-consumption.

uxui.title: Are the advertisements clearly identified as such and do they have a real economic value in the service ?
uxui.test: Are the ads skippable?
uxui.description: Targeted or untargeted advertising can be an essential source of revenue for the digital service, the added value  must be sufficient to justify these promotional inserts, and users must be able to distinguish these advertising banners  from the contents of the service.

uxui.title: How well is the user's attention controlled by the service ?
uxui.test: Has a diagnosis of attentional design been carried out?
uxui.description: The  user's attention is an asset that should be considered scarce and valuable. From this perspective, respect for the user also depends on his ability to focus his attention on the elements of his choice, rather than those that the service would like to highlight.

uxui.title: Are the legal display and communication standards on the RGAA (public service and private company with more than € 250 million turnover) taken into account ?
uxui.test: Are RGAA compliance assessments available?
uxui.description: All digital media must be accessible by everyone. It is necessary to be able to keep the user informed of the level of accessibility and of the  underway efforts to improve the service. This information must be available and explicitly marked in the user's path.

contents.test: Do you use carousels? Are they useful for understanding the service?

contents.title: Is the duration of animated content that has been validated as necessary optimized ?

contents.title: Does every video content have an associated lifespan ?

contents.title: Have we defined the proportion of feed type content (hot news type content, etc.) and stock (cold content, long tail in SEO) ?
contents.test: How is recent content promoted?

All this information must be used so that outdated information is deleted or if necessary reworked to reduce its size, and finally be made available to users on archive links to clearly express that this content is old. Keeping old content can be useful to keep acquired SEO referencing.

contents.title: Is the content unique across the service ?
contents.test: Do you have duplicate content tracking?

contents.title: Are user notifications necessary and can they be deactivated by the user ?

contents.description: The notification methods can use resource-consuming technologies and certain practices aim to multiply them which increases the environmental footprint of the service. The system fonts are embedded in the presentation tools and are not conveyed, the flows are therefore reduced when they are used.

frontend.title: Is a clean version available for prints ?
frontend.test: Is the print size specified to reduce space and ink used?
frontend.description: The flows of dematerialization are sometimes broken, and require the production of writing on paper. The user in some cases may also be more comfortable using printed documents rather than 100% electronic. Prints have a significant environmental footprint, whether in the consumption of paper, consumables such as cartridges and printing inks. The presentation needs in electronics or in printing are different; on the other hand, limiting the environmental footprint must lead to a reduction in the density and volume of printed information.

frontend.title: Do you limit the number of fonts loaded for the service ?
frontend.test: How many Fonts are used? Are all of these Fonts necessary? are they web-safe?
frontend.description:
Each font is encoded in a file presenting all the associated symbols, which represents a large volume of data exchanged and manipulated.
The system fonts are embedded in the presentation tools and are not conveyed, the flows are therefore reduced when they are used.

frontend.title: Is the service developed in accordance with RGAA recommendations ?
frontend.test: What is the level of RGAA compliance?
frontend.description: Beyond the purely regulatory aspects, anticipation of the inclusion of accessibility is necessary to ensure coverage of this subject throughout the service life. Anticipating future points of regulations and standards makes it possible to perpetuate the service by limiting the need for updates dictated by the legal environment.

frontend.title: Are the animations necessary, desired by the user ?
frontend.test: What animations could be replaced by an infographic?
frontend.description: The processing of animations consumes technical resources and distracts the attention of users, moreover animations are generally dependent on the technical characteristics of the terminals and generate incompatibilities which artificially lead to the renewal of the equipment.
frontend.score: Number of animations analyzed / Number of animations

frontend.title: Is a CSS alternative available for an animation ?
frontend.test: What animations could be replaced by a CSS alternative?
frontend.description: The information transmitted to the user by the animations can also be managed by CSS mechanisms which are less heavy and therefore more resource efficient.
frontend.score: Number of animations analyzed / Number of animations

frontend.title: Are cartography objects, animations, videos presented in a static mode ?
frontend.test: Is a static image displayed rather than a mapping, animation, video object?
frontend.description: Mapping objects are not always relevant to be presented in the form of dynamic and interactive objects. The static image version of the plans can provide the user with enough information without having to interact with the object. Mapping objects are complex and require processing resources and the use of sensors, which the image versions of plans avoid. The user retains the possibility of interaction by activating the dynamic version but only at his request.
frontend.score: Number of dynamic objects analyzed / Number of dynamic objects

frontend.title: Can positioning tracking be satisfied with a lower frequency ?
frontend.test: Is the locate accuracy specified with an uncertainty tolerance?
frontend.description: The technical operations carried out on the front end can implement physical sensors of the user device. The solicitation of these sensors, and their control processes can lead to premature wear and in case of failure push to renew the device. Certain software techniques can reduce the use of physical sensors, or ensure that they are used with the minimum of constraints.

frontend.title: Are unnecessary searches limited by local search engines ?
frontend.test: From how many letters is the data transmitted to search or auto-complete engines?
frontend.description: Using local search engines in the service allows users to access the information they need faster without having to browse the entire service. These search engines are therefore effective from the point of view of environmental efficiency and user assistance. On the other hand, local search engines do not have all the information to offer answers adapted to users and rely on remote resources. It is important to reduce the exchanges with these remote resources so as not to cancel out the benefit acquired by the use of the search engine.

frontend.title: Is the size of data stored on user device limited ?
frontend.test: Is maximum size of component transfered to user device defined?
frontend.description: All items transfered to user device have impact on the network, on compute time required to process. Reducing the size of these items is important.
